name: Fairfield Inn New York Long Island City/Manhattan View

reviews.text: The rooms and lobby were clean. I was disapointed the rooms did not have wireless internet. When I went to hook up using the internet connection in the room it was very hard to connect and I gave up. Later the hotel employee at the front desk told me the service was horrible and it hardly ever worked. The hotel breakfast was poor. We were told we were suppose to have City Views, the customer service agent who assisted me did not even give me the option and gave me another room with a view of a side street.
reviews.title: Could have been better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed there two nights during our US trip. It was actually quite easy to drive there. As their parking was full we parked our car outside. Staff was actually really helpful from the moment we entered reception. They provided as all information during our stay and everything was done with natural smile and professional manner.
reviews.title: Nice, comfortable hotel, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious enough, quite basic, but equipped with everything you need to have during your hotel stay. Only one interesting or annoying thing was shower. I actually had to go to reception to ask, how to turn it on and make water running. Really unusual way I have to say. You'll manage - don't worry - it's not broken.
reviews.title: nice hotel but I won't be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the morning basic breakfast was served downstairs. Again, simple, but good start of the day.
reviews.title: It was ok :/

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the lobby there was PC with Internet connection and printer, which was great help to print some discounted car park coupons for central NYC.
reviews.title: No complaints what so ever..... except one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our flight to the west coast was canceled because of the early freak snow storm that grounded much of the northeast. All hotels near JFK were book,but the Marriott folks got us a room in this property. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and kind. The room was more than adequate and the property seems new or newly renovated. We had a good night's sleep and decent free breakfast. Recommend this property for anyone who needs to be in the Brooklyn and Queens area.
reviews.title: A life saver during the early freak Oct. storm

reviews.text: I recently stayed here 10/11/2011-10/15/2011 on a business trip. First Im becoming a fan of Fairfield Inns especially this one. I like the neighborhood, its a typical working class NYC neighborhood, I walked around everywhere. Its not Manhattan that's why I like it here. It's a nice change of pace
reviews.title: Superb Staff

reviews.text: I have to say the staff attention to guests is stupendous. It was raining, I asked if I could borrow an umbrella, it appeared in less than a minute. I asked if I could pay for an upgrade since I got a small room. Ahmed recognized I was a Marriott Rewards frequent guest and he upgraded me to a high floor with panoramic views of NYC, a larger room...... I asked to reserve a car to the airport on Saturday and Anastasia at the front desk waved at me later on my way out and confirmed that it was done for me. Smiles. The hotel has free shuttle to the 33rd/Rawson stop on the 7 subway about 10 blocks away. Honestly, I expect this kind of attention from a 4 star hotel like the Marriott, the W or the Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Great for Business Trip to Queens/Brooklyn

reviews.text: This Fairfield Inn (on Van Dam St) is typical of most but different. The attention to service is focused. People are friendly and service oriented, one would think it's a hotel in California, LOL. Also congrats to their IT staff, the 2 computers in the business area ran so fast I thought for a second they were Macs, LOL but Windows XP, oooooh. Nice efficient and fast computers. The breakfast is typical of any Fairfield Inn: hard boiled eggs, yoghurt, soy milk, cow's milk, cereal, even Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, and fruit, toast, juices, egg and ham croissant, etc. Again, this was different than a lot of Fairfield Inns, there was staff visibly cleaning, replenishing food and coffee every minute or two. It's quite noticeable the attention to service here.
reviews.title: still awaiting a refund

reviews.text: I find this place to be the new and successful business model for hotels. Predictably, it' s a Marriott brand. I've stayed at 8 Fairfield Inns this year and I like them a lot. I found all 8 hotels always busy and reasonably priced and this one is too, even for NYC and even more reasonable through the Negotiator.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as an alternative to Manhattan - seeking accommodation that was reasonably priced without being too far away from the main tourist attractions.
reviews.title: alternative to Manhattan

reviews.text: The basics: The room was clean and well-maintained, and the bed was very comfortable. The continental breakfast provided a fair selection of food and drink - more than what you find in most motels or basic hotels.
reviews.title: Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Previous reviews have dealt with this issue, which the hotel management is acutely aware of. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk from the nearest subway station. The neighborhood is industrial, not pretty - but it felt perfectly safe, even around midnight. The hotel provides a shuttle every 30 minutes, and a pickup from the station (until 11 p.m.) when called. This worked well for us when we came. The upside is that although Manhattan can be reached only by subway, the ride is very short - about 10-15 minutes to Grand Central or Times Square, and the train runs frequently.
reviews.title: Satisfied, not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: large, well-furnished room; en-suite (!) jacuzzi;
reviews.title: Bed Bugs...

reviews.text: Cons: 'free' wifi in the rooms (and lobby) is so slow that even mail or news sites cannot be accessed. This is mildly annoying - because a normal broadband connection is NOT free. The bath/toilet connects directly to the bedroom by means of a louvered door, and cannot be sealed off (with implications for sound and smell).
reviews.title: Perfect for vacationers on a budget!

reviews.text: All in all great stay! Rooms are tiny! Think "cruise ship" but really no problems! Staff is great! Thanks Estephanie( ?) and Nina! Everyone asks if you need or want anything. Breakfast selections are good unless overloaded by a busload of kids! Frequent shuttles to the trains and lots of suggestions for meals. Driver offers trips to restaurants by train station. Trains schedule changes can be troublesome figuring out how to get back but hey it happens! Suggestions to eat at Bantry Bay - on the money - great food, service! Easy walk and occaisonal "pop -ins" by celebs since Silvercup studios is so close! Fun! We brought coolers and snacks in to share with the family in the evening Had a ball! Beer in hotel Market was a plus!
reviews.title: The Wedding Family!

reviews.text: Stayed 11/17/11
reviews.title: Near New - Far from public transportation

reviews.text: Location: .60 miles from the 33rd st. Subway Stop. Took 20-30mins to walk from subway to hotel. There is a hotel shuttle that will pick you up from subway (but that takes 20-30mins - so i walked). There are not to many taxis and buses in this area as its farther south LIC.
reviews.title: Very bad!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel does offer a 30min rounding shuttle from hotel to subway during the day.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: Food: Hotel offered 7 menus for places that delivered til 11pm. There are a few places to walk to, but after a 30min walk I passed on that.
reviews.title: Good location, clean, good price, poor customer service

aka: Fairfield Inn New York Long Island City/Queens Hotel Long Island City
